title: How does it work?
content: SOUL is a tool that allows you to change (mock) your GPS data, enabled by Developed Options. When you set SOUL as the “mock location app” in Developer Options section in your settings, it provides a this augmented GPS signal to the entire system, meaning all apps on your phone will receive that signal and locate you on Null Island.

title: Is it safe for my phone?
content: Yes! The app uses standard Android developer feature and does not modify your system files. When you stop using using SOUL, your phone’s real GPS sill function as it did before.

title: I turned the app on but it’s not working?
content: Check that your Developer Options are on (to enable Developer Mode- locate Build Number of your device using the search feature, tap the Build Number quickly 7 times, this will automatically enable Developer Options in you Settings) -> Inside Developer Options -> Select Mock Location App-> Select SOUL

title: I turned the app off but it’s still showing that I am on Null Island?
content: Close the app, and any other app you were using while SOUL was ON. This should reset your GPS back to how it was before. If that doesn’t work, restart your phone.

title: Why does the location sometime ‘jump’?
content: Modern phones use a ‘fused’ location from GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular networks. If SOUL GPS signal strongly disagrees with other network data, the system might briefly ‘jump’ to your physical location. SOUL tries to minimize this, but occasional ‘jumps’ still occur. To minimize this, you may want to turn off your Wi-Fi or set your phone to Airplane mode.
